enrolled-dateline.#text: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Friday, the third day of January, two thousand and fourteen

congress.#text: One Hundred Thirteenth Congress of the United States of America

official-title.#text: To address shortages and interruptions in the availability of propane and other home heating fuels in the United States, and for other purposes.

role.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives.
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate.

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Home Heating Emergency Assistance Through Transportation Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Home Heating Emergency Assistance Through Transportation Act of 2014

header.#text: Propane and home heating fuel emergency transportation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall remain in effect until May 31, 2014, unless the
, after consultation with the Governors of affected States, determines that the emergency for which the exemption was provided ends before that date.

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a covered emergency exemption issued by the

external-xref.#tail: of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations, or extended under section 390.25 of such title that—

text.#text: was issued or extended during the period beginning on February 5, 2014, and ending on the date of enactment of this Act; and
provided regulatory relief for commercial motor vehicle operations providing direct assistance supporting the delivery of propane and home heating fuels.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: from issuing or extending a covered emergency exemption beyond May 31, 2014, under other Federal law.

text.#text: Nothing in subsection (a) may be construed to prohibit the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: HR 4076 ENR: Home Heating Emergency Assistance Through Transportation Act of 2014
